learning_outcomes.description: Understand the central ideas associated with some important jurisprudential traditions, including legal positivism, natural law theory, critical legal theories and evolutionary legal theory.
Engage critically with the above traditions, drawing on relevant legal and philosophical literature.

assessments.task_description:
The in-semester exam will be held during semester.  This is a closed book exam. Details will be posted on Blackboard.

The examination is designed to test the students’ knowledge and understanding of the key ideas, concepts, issues and debates in legal theory and their ramifications for the practical operation of the law.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
